title: How to write 5,000 words a day - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it’s possible; I have done so a few times in the past. However, 5000 words is not a breeze to compose on the fly, so the topic you are writing will make all the difference. The easiest way to pull off a 5000-word essay would be to write from existing notes, or from an outline you’ve already made. At the very least, you’ll want to have your source materials already read and mentally digested, highlighted and bookmarked as necessary. If you’ve yet to do the readings for your essay, well, add another 4–6 hours, at minimum, to the work you are looking at. Of course, if your essay is on a personal topic (that is, requires no reading in advance), then 5000 words in a single day would be easier to pull off. Regardless of topic, the best way to write an essay (or any kind of assignment, really) on the fly is the following: Decide on your thesis. Boil it down to a single sentence if at all possible. For example: “Social Learning Theory proposes that people learn not only through classical and operant conditioning, but also through observing and imitating others in their immediate environment.” Estimate how much space you will need to properly explain your thesis-and in doing so, write your entire intro to the essay. Typically, for a 5000 word paper (15–20 pages), you’re looking at 1–2 pages for a sufficiently detailed introduction.Figure out what your suppprting points will be, and how much space each will require to explain, support with quotations and thoughts of the prominent figures in your field, and so on. For me, the easiest way to do this is in point form: it helps me to quickly assemble my ideas, and figure out what I want to be sure to include.Assuming you’ve done your readings, and made notes, beforehand, decide how you want to incorporate these into your paper. Do you want to have a separate section reviewing the literature on your topic? Or do you want to include it in the points you are making to support your thesis? Either way, in point form, jot down who had what ideas, and the page numbers/etc of quotes you plan on either including outright, or paraphrasing.To bring your paper to a close, formulate a final section on where the most-recent research on your topic is headed/what other topics it logically links up to/in general, why the topic continues to be important to your field of study. This is a smooth way to lead into your conclusion, and can also be tailored for length as needed later on.Draft your concluding paragraph(s), and your reference list.Take a break, you’ve earned it! Now go back and “fill in” each section, one by one.For an essay of this length written in one day, you are most likely going to want to go back and revise significantly. It’s normal for a first draft of this length to be pretty rough in terms of correct citation format, word choice and overall readability. So make sure to spend a solid 90–120 minutes going over it before you submit.Good luck, you can do this!

I think this is absolutely realistic and you can get a very high-quality essay by the end. Although, perhaps, if you have no experience in writing this type of work, it really can cause considerable difficulty. However, if you can write a good essay for 500 words, then you can also write it for 5000 words. If you know all the basic steps you need to take to write a work, if you know how to find and work with sources, then this task is absolutely possible. If there is nothing like this, then you can ask for help here. For experienced professionals, writing 5,000 words in a few hours will not be very difficult. But I would recommend not to run your work to a state of tight deadlines. The ability to work gradually and the availability of time for full-fledged essay edits may bring better results on the total. In addition, it will allow less nervous and organize work more systematically.
